revised_title: An Investigation of a Tumour Found in the Human Placenta
tldr: The author presents a case study of a tumour found in the human placenta, providing insights into its structure, function, and the role of the placenta in fetal development. The tumour, which was solid and organized, did not interfere with the normal functioning of the placenta, suggesting that the vessels of the placenta possess formative properties not previously known.
